definition: to cater to/to pander to
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
variant of 合[he2]

sentences.english: The grocer studies to please his customers.
sentences.chinese: 杂货商老板考虑着要迎合顾客。

sentences.english: Cater to their needs, and be prepared to handle every imaginable mistake.
sentences.chinese: 要迎合他们的口味，准备应对每一个想象得到的错误。

sentences.english: Whitehead's philosophy meets such need of the contemporary ear.
sentences.chinese: 怀特海哲学迎合了这种时代的需要。

sentences.english: He always panders to low tastes.
More and more newspapers are trying to pander to people's vulgar tastes.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多报纸在努力迎合人们的低级趣味了。

sentences.english: The three methods in the research on history of education cater to the needs of postmodernists.
sentences.chinese: “三条腿”的方法和特点迎合后现代主义者的口味。

sentences.english: He doctored up the story to suit the public.
sentences.chinese: 他修改了小说以迎合公众的口味。

sentences.english: The INTP should practice meeting these needs in conflict situations.
sentences.chinese: INTP应该学着在冲突中迎合他们旳需要。

sentences.english: A variety of studio flats cater for different needs.
sentences.chinese: 多款开放式套房间隔迎合不同需要。

sentences.english: Stop pandering to other people's approval and start developing your own standards.
sentences.chinese: 停止迎合别人的赞许，开始培养自己的标准。

sentences.english: These two products cater to two different audiences.
sentences.chinese: 这两种产品迎合了两种不同的您。

sentences.english: Internalisation of popular dress-code, adaption to social-normative expections.
sentences.chinese: 流行服装内在化，以迎合标准化社会的期望。

sentences.english: Around Beijing's small alleyways , an underground economy caters to construction workers.
sentences.chinese: 在北京的小胡同中，黑市迎合了建筑工人的需求。

sentences.english: He pandered to her at these things.
Some tabloid newspaper cater to low tastes.
sentences.chinese: 有些小型报纸迎合低级趣味。

sentences.english: Instead of trying to drive engagement of your current user base through updates, it seems you may be better off going after new users.
sentences.chinese: 与其通过更新迎合你的老用户不如多吸引一些新用户。

definition: to try to please
to like/fond of/to prefer/to love/one's tastes/preference
to comply/to conform to/in tune with/adapting to/to adjust to
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
esthetics/appreciating the arts/taste
to act cleverly to get what one desires/to get the best at least expense
to satisfy/to meet (the needs of)/satisfied/content
to flaunt/to advertise/to parade/boost/excessive praise
tide/current/trend
target audience/audience
to adapt to sb's taste/to fit sb's fancy
to pursue (a goal etc) stubbornly/to seek after/to woo
favor/liking/love/jubilation/joy
to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains
sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
requirement/to require/(economics) demand
